QuizName: If You Can Find The 9 Real Monopoly Properties, You're Legally The "Board Game Friend"
QuizDescription: But if you can't, prepare for the Water Works.

QuestionName: Which of the brown properties is the real one?
Lesson: This $60 property is the favourite of those unfortunate enough to roll a 3 on turn 1.

QuestionName: Which is the true light blue?
Lesson: Vermont Ave is one of the most likely squares to land on in the first turn, so it's bound to be brought up early!

QuestionName: Which of these Saints is in the light purple group?
Lesson: St. Charles Place is the light purple property, and St. James is an orange! If you didn't get tripped up here, you must be a Monopoly fiend!

QuestionName: Which southern state is part of the oranges?
Lesson:
Tennessee Avenue
I rarely buy the orange properties, so Tennessee Avenue makes me shudder at paying $950 because of a hotel.

QuestionName: Which of these is the real Railroad?
Lesson: B&O stands for Baltimore and Ohio, something I didn't know until about 5 seconds ago!

QuestionName: Which of these properties is one of the reds?
Lesson: Illinois is one of the most commonly landed on squares, based on it being 14 spaces away from jail. Having a Chance Card might send you there, too.

QuestionName: Ok, this yellow property has a pretty silly name. But what is it?
Lesson: This is my favourite property on the board, and I will trade you all 4 Railroads for it.

QuestionName: Which of these green properties is legit?
Lesson: I always call this one "NorCalAve." My friends love it.

QuestionName: And lastly, what's Boardwalk's partner in crime?
Lesson: If you can get both Boardwalk and Park Place, you're bound to win the game, as long as your opponents don't flip the board!
